paper_abstract: The National Energy Research Scientific Computing Center (NERSC) was originally launched as a computing center for the exclusive support of magnetic confinement fusion research in the US. One example of the numerous computational achievements enabled by NERSC is the development Of the global gyrokinetic particle-in-cell approach for the simulation of turbulent transport in tokamak fusion devices.
paper_title: NERSC's Impact on Advances of Global Gyrokinetic PIC Codes for Fusion Energy Research
